Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever been”
Reviews.Author: TaytayManc
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friends for couple of days. It was really cheap but the hygiene level of the hotel was unaccpetable.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: jbjaidee
Reviews.Content: Close to many la attractions and right in the middle of Thai town. Rooms are not much to talk about, but it is a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks but No thanks. No more cheap hotels for me.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy S
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Hollywood Inn Express mothers day weekend 2011 for 3 nights. I must say it was worse than motel 6! Hotels.com said that there was high speed wifi and there was free breakfast in the morning. When I arrivedit smelled bad in the office and the owner was on the computer doing whatever and didnt greet me until I finally got sick of waiting and said excuse me. He couldnt find my name in the system even though I paid weeks in advance. I showed him my reciept then I all of a sudden popped up in his computer. I asked him about breakfast and he told me that was false. Then I asked him about the free wifi and he told me it wasnt free but gave it to me anyway since hotels.com said it was free. The wifi turned out to barely even work on my laptop it was very slow. The parking Lot was extra small if its full goodluck getting out. The beds were too hard and it smells horrible in the rooms like they werent cleaned well. I will never go to another Express hotel if its not a name brand like holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, No Elevator, Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: oceanrfrizz
Reviews.Content: I paid about 80 bucks a night, the hotel is kinda run down, but the location is good, in a safe neghboorhood, the parking is limited and also they have no elevator, and I was staying on the 3 floor I have to carry my luggage all the way up, the carpet in the room is smeel look filty.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Soulweeper
Reviews.Content: Good service, good room, good location. No complains at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra v
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last year, the location is great and the hotel was ok. I have one question though. We'll be back this month, our plane doesn't land until 9.00 PM, so we'll be arriving late is that a problem? Does anyone have an emailadress of this hotel. Calling from the Netherlands is pretty expensive. Thanks anyway

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend! Amazing Service, thanks”
Reviews.Author: Renee L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our holiday to LA. We wanted somewhere reasonably priced with good location to Hollywood action. This hotel was fantastic, not just because of the location but we were so impressed with the service. I left my passport and wallet in the hotel room when we left and we got an email straight away to say that the cleaners had found it. We were already in Las Vegas and they arranged for it to be FedExed to us overnight. They arranged everything so quickly for us, and we were very impressed. We offered to tip them via our credit card, and they refused. Very genuine and kind service. The rooms were clean, large and public transport was very close by. great value for money. We also enjoyed the fresh donuts and coffee for breakfast - a true American experience! Would definitely recommend staying here if you want true value for money with honest and good service.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: Momof2girls803
Reviews.Content: I made reservation on hotels.com but when I got there, the desk clerk told me (and 2 little kids) that the hotel is completely booked (seriously???) Parking was empty and it was late at night. He was extremely rude and didnot even apologize for the inconvinience. The pictures of hotel online looks great but in person, its cheap and rundown! Hotels.com was very nice and set us to stay at Ramada Limited 2 blocks away and I'm soooo glad to have stayed there than that old disgusting motel! Ive read some reviews here...and honestly I really believe that the desk clerk is prejudiced against women!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Okay but desk clerk was rude”
Reviews.Author: PatJay
Reviews.Content: My daughter, two grandsons and me stayed at Hollywood Inn Express North on Jul 19 checked out on Jul 20, 2011. My daughter booked the reservation online. She did not have my credit card at the time to book it so she used hers and said that we had AAA. When we got there - we told the desk clerk that I would be paying and I had AAA. He said I could pay but not use my AAA because it was booked in my daughter's name. I explained the situation - basically it was to bad and we had to pay full price. Ialso asked him to put the room in mya name and said no because he was booked. I don't understand -we are the exact same people who originally booked the room. It seems he was perjudiced against women. Also the breakfast was stale donuts and juice. The donuts were hard as rocks.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!! STAY AWAY! HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: esala11
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! When we got there, there was a guest already complaining and the owner was extremely rude to her. It took about 30 minutes for us to check in. Then he gave us a room that had not been cleaned yet! This was really gross. When we finally settled in our room, there was no toilet paper and the sink would not drain. The room smelled like mold and the beds were extremely hard. The parking lot had about 10 spots in it and if you didn't find a spot there, you have to park your car about 1/2 a mile down which is not safe at all. The area is not a secure area. I read the reviews before staying and I though people were just complaining but it is all TRUE. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. You will have the worst experience and customer service ever!

Reviews.Title: “cheap sleep”
Reviews.Author: sarahbanks
Reviews.Content: checking in was no hassle, there was polite lobby staff and complimentary beverages.the rooms were expectedly-bland. but the color scheme of the hotel was a nice aesthetic feature.i would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a cheap last minute place to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Go to your next choice and bypass this one.”
Reviews.Author: Barb033
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 2nd floor, think room # was 112. The unit had a very strong offensive odor that I believe was dryrot or mold. It was strongest in the bathroom and the fiberglass tub surround was separating from wall. It was hard to sleep with the strong smell. Counters were clean, but tub was old and kind of disgusting. No way would you sit down and take a bath. Did not want to walk barefoot on the carpet either. Ice machine broken also.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: hoteles1986
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was broken glass in the parking lot from a car that got broken in to the night before, then when we arrive to the reception there was another guest complaining about the noise. When I told the manager I wanted to cancel my reservation given the circumstances he didnt accept my reasons. SO BOTTOM LINE DONT GO THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible........!! Terrible....!! Terrible.......!!!”
Reviews.Author: IRS2010
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I made an online Reservation through Hotels.com for day stay in Hollywood Inn Express North and i got the confirmation through hotels.com. when i showed my confirmation in Help desk in Hollywood Express Inn North, they informed me no rooms available and all sold out. When i inquired, they informed all rooms sold out and manager of Hollywood Express Inn North was Terrible and RUDE. Even after confirming the reservation he desperately told us to get out from their hotel. Is this the Way they treat their customer.......!! VERY RUDE AND TERRIBLE SERVICE.......!!

Reviews.Title: “NASTY, MOLDY, DIRTY!!! Horrible Stay!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blueyedgirl_1982
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE WORST MOTEL I HAVE EVER SEEN!! Please do yourself a favor and do NOT stay at this location!!!! This motel is horribly discusting!! The rooms are fithy dirty, definately not suitable for children or anyone for that matter! Clearly there was a water leak that had been leaking for years I'm sure, which you could clearly see they simply just tried to paint the stain, however there was mold growing all along the wall and door frame!! The carpets, bathroom, and bedding were absolutly discusting!!! We asked for extra clean sheets to line the room with and they hastled us about getting more sheets. The walls are paper thin, we heard everything from the people next to us talking, doors slamming, people upstairs and the water running all morning from people showering. The only reason that we decided to actually stay here was becuase we arrived at 1130 PM and we were too exhausted to search for another option. Absolutly horrible!! Again, do yourself a favor and book at a Motel 6 for the same price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but a great value”
Reviews.Author: jimfromiowa
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation, then read the reviews and was a little nervous. But the shower was hot, the sheets were clean, there was a modern lock on the door, the pool was clean, I loved Thaitown, and we were so close to the Hollywood Bowl (Sting concert!) and the tourist sites. Stayed two nights with my kids. My wife would have called it 'shabby', but she didn't come! 'Breakfast' was donuts and orange drink; we ate out.

Reviews.Title: “PAY MORE AND STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TrishaMarie81
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST place I have ever stayed in and my husband and I travel a fair bit. The rug had more stains on it then there were clean areas, the bed also had marks on it, as did the pillows and towels (It is called BLEACH, use it). It took everything in me to lay on that bed and sleep. I don't think I moved the whole night. Please take my advice and stay anywhere else. On a positive note though, the front desk clerk was polite and friendly. That is definitely not enough to overlook the conditions of the room, though.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From This Place!!”
Reviews.Author: wicked2583
Reviews.Content: This is a HORRIBLE HOTEL, dirty and scary. Me and my wife thought it couldn't be so bad and IT IS. PLEASE PEOPLE READ THE REVIEWS THIS IS A NO NO NO NO PLACE TO STAY. We regret our decision and we will be willing to pay $150 or $200 per night at another hotel. D O N O T S T A Y H E R E!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Stay at YOUR OWN RISK!”
Reviews.Author: secretdiamonds4u
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was going to the Price Is Right (CBS STUDIOS). I was told that this hotel is 5miles away. I booked this reservation online and I called the Hotel to ask about a early check in and I was told that would not be a problem. I get to the hotel and the staff was EXTREMELY RUDE and told me that I could not get my room until 2 pm. I arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am. I am furious! Then I waited in the lobby which had nowhere to sit. I found a lawn chair outside and brought that into the lobby and the housekeeping woman demanded that I get out of the chair and put it back outside. I yelled at her to get out of my face. She was crazy as mollasses because it was raining outside. 12 noon when they decided that they had a room available for me I was able to check in. I get to my room opened the door and was hit with a stinge of DEATH. I go to turn the heat on...Guess What? That did not work and then I seen a small rodent dart across the floor! I could not run back down to the lobby fast enough. I get there demanded that the man who checked me in come back to the room with me and see what I had experienced. He get's to my room and fumbles with the heater not caring that I had told him about the rodent. He said...The heater does not work so I will just put you in another room. I demanded my money back and would pay more elsewhere for health and safety issues. He refused to refund me but claimed to upgrade my room! WHATEVER!

Reviews.Title: “dont go there they have stolen my camera and the charger -they are thieves”
Reviews.Author: raph20
Reviews.Content: hey..don t go to this hotel..the first day my camera has disappear and the secong day my charger..crazy but true..SO PLEASE DO NOT GO THERE

Reviews.Title: “If you like donuts for breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveller3
Reviews.Content: Pros: short walk to Metro train station, free and fast wifi internet, airconditioning/heating in room, lots of places to eat nearby, building is well-lit at night. Cons: Not the prettiest part of town, indifferent front desk staff, smelly room, free breakfast are donuts! I think overall it's a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “decent room and service”
Reviews.Author: Lab4games
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 1 night and tried to use coupon but was rejected. the guy countered offer us a king bed for $60. we told him no, and asked for something else. he then countered offer us 3 queen bed for $80. sounds ok to the 3 of us. room is big since it has 3 bed. room is clean enough for us to accept. the frontdesk guy is friendly n helpful. nearby is a restaurant that sells thai food (tg express) and take out. great food there if u r staying in this motel.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth to pay more - somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jackinthebox_sushi
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad, but you need to take the bus or metro to get to the "close by" sights like the Walk of Fame or the Kodak Theatre. The room was rather spacious, but quite dark, gloomy, not especially clean, the floor uneven, some of the towels property of big hotel chains, and the mattress squeaking and uncomfortable or simply old and worn out. During our stay, unlike in other accommodations, I haven't seen anyone using the pool and wouldn't have used it myself. There was a fridge in the room, but it was noisy that we had to switch it off to be able to sleep. The continental breakfast consists of awful coffee, even worse orange-colored drink, and , if you re lucky / fast enough, a sugar-coated donut. No hot water, no milk, no plates, no napkins. Wifi was working without problem. Parking spaces are limited and even if some are available it's not easy to get in / out with a bigger car. You shouln't expect any help from the personnel. I needed to print out 1 page (tickets booked over the internet) - the receptionist pretended to have never seen a USB stick before, and coulnd't tell any place close by where it might be possible to print. Altogether the personnel was rather rude and the maid entered the room around 8.30-9.00 am without even knocking (no "do not disturb" sign available). Lucky we were just about to leave anyway. Most disturbing for us was that, just about half an hour after we had left the hotel and were already on the highway to the next destination, we got a message from the bank that they charged the creditcard with additional 75$. We inquired by phone and were accused to have stolen the bedspread. Well, what happened was that we put the bedspread aside (folded and put in a corner) on our first evening, the housekeeper removed it the next morning and we haven't seen it for the rest of our stay. Obviously, we didn't miss it as it was old and smelly. After two more calls, talking with the manager and explaining the circumstances, he talked to the housekeeping staff and our money is back now - apparently minus some bank charge, but at least most of it is back. So, altogether not the best experience - it's ok to stay there for 1-2 nights, but if you can, choose a different accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “I left this place very angry.”
Reviews.Author: Kahendri
Reviews.Content: I am not a very needy guest. This hotel was a nightmare. Do NOT stay here. I won't even go into details, but they were rude and dirty. You be better off sleeping in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly”
Reviews.Author: crismanila77
Reviews.Content: Was fooled by the pictures in hotel.com when I made my reservations. I also should have checked the reviews in this website first before booking a room. Anyway, I made the terrible mistake of bringing my mom and 2 younger siblings who were vacationing from overseas to this ghastly and rundown motel. The room we stayed in was large, but it was old, dirty and absolutely not good for tourists. Even if you are a budget traveler, this place does not even come close to something less than remotely decent. Bad. The front desk reeked so strongly that I wanted to slash my self for even deciding to not cancel our reservations. To make matters worst, they served breakfast in the same smelly office. Breakfast was nothing less than despicable. Don't make the same mistake I did. Do yourself a favor, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Life's Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: srg9
Reviews.Content: I was there with my parents and sister, so we were 4 people and had a reservation of one room with 2 double beds . WE reached the hotel at 1:00pm but the manager didnt allow us to enter before 2:00pm as that was the check in time. We had lunch nearby and returned. The manager was highly rude and did not agree that a room was booked for 4 people. To avoid any further arguments I asked how much would I need to pay for 2 extra people and he asked for 50$ per person. I had researched many hotels before that and none had such an expensive guest rate. I asked him to give me the receipt and he bluntly refused. Upon asking the reason he just said that I wudnt give you any receipt of this and you might as well leave as he didnt want us to stay there. He was insane. I called up hotels.com and they spoke to him. He told them that he offered us only 10$/guest and that he is refusing as I tried to hit him!!! On hearing this I immediately left that place!

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrible terrible place - you are not safe here”
Reviews.Author: harrassedmother
Reviews.Content: DO NOT - I REPEAT NOT- GO TO THIS HOTEL. My daughter arrived there on Monday, 1st September 2008 and during her first night, somebody entered her room and stole £500 from her drawer WHILE SHE WAS ASLEEP. When she complained the next morning -not seriously complained but voiced her fears tro get some help - the staff became hostile and angry and accused her of being drunk and losing the money herself which was entirely untrue as she had gone to bed at 10 pm the night before severely jet-lagged. The next day she noticed the door opened inwards by itself so obviously a faulty door but the staff refused to move her and still did not believe her story about being robbed. it has been a NIGHTMARE. The staff won't put us through to her room and even told us 'not to call here again' CAN YOU BELIEVE IT?? DO NOT NOT NOT go to this horrible disgusting HELLHOLE. I have asked hotels.com to blacklist it. Vanessa We booked the hotel through Hotels.com and we have already complained and will try to get the hotel blacklisted.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there, even you are prepared!”
Reviews.Author: saimok
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there on August. Before we went to Hollywood Express Inn we read through many bad comments here but we though that "It should be fine if we are well prepared". We were wrong! They treated us like we are homelesses begging for a shelter! Accomodation: Ofcause, the room was dirty and smelly as you could expected from a cheap hotel. They lied about Wifi internet connection and Microwave. You have to pay $10 deposit for the remote control, the refrigurator is in a bad shape, the bath room curtain was dirty and smell like a rotten fish, and lastly, "have your own towel, soap, and shampoo" is my healthy recommendation. Security: The neighborhood is unkind especially if you have to come alone at night, beggers are everywhere and number of noisy cars will wake you up all night (I'm glad that I haven't heart any gun fire yet). On the second day I found that my expansion zipp was opened! Somebody might have tried to open my baggage! Fortunately I locked it securely before I left the room (part of the well prepare things). In responding to my self-awareness, I had no ice bucket and there is a pile of dirt in the bath tub in that day. Perhaps if I intended to left some dollars unattened I might be treated better. Hospitality: The manager is not kind. Before I came I called her to ask about direction but she refuse to give anything unless I have booked her room or give her my creditcard number. On the check-out date she phoned me on 11:00 AM and said "Check out time!" I asked her for 15 minutes more for packing the stuff. On 11:15 she called again and told "I have to clean the room". Isn't the check out time is 12:00? Why she keep chasing us after spent 3 awful nights in this shelter?

Reviews.Title: “Manager moved parking tiicket from car!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: madonnica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this dirty hotel last summer. the worst part about it besides the rock hard beds, thin as paper walls, no elevators, and filthy floors was the lack of parking spots. There were like maybe 12 parking spots in the lot, not enough even for this size of a hotel. There were never empty street parking nearby. A few weeks ago, our credit card was charged over $100.00 . When we investigated the charges, we discovered it was from an unpaid parking ticket during our stay here, from parking on the sidewalk. The night this happened, we were pissed to find no available parking in the lot, and none on the street, so we complained to the manager, and he had us park on the sidewalk, which he said was okay since it was his property. We were not the only ones who had to park on the sidewalk that night. The manager must have moved the parking ticket first thing in the morning, before we found it and complained to him about getting the ticket in the first place. If we had known about the ticket then, it would have been like $30.00....but since we didn't pay it on time, it was close to $150.00. BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL< AND THIS MANAGER!!!! THEY ARE A SHADY FAMILY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not for families.”
Reviews.Author: jennallen
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend that this hotel not be used. At our time of arrival we found that the management was very rude. We were told by the management that extra pillows were $5.00 extra a pillow. The rooms were very dirty and the sheets and towels were stained. The bathroom had mold around the ceiling and around the bathtub/shower. The walls are very thin so be aware that if you have children this is not a very good hotel. The floor of the rooms were very dirty with food and what looked like sawdust around the edges. Our reservation was for 3 nights. We stayed one and packed up and found another hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty accurate all in all”
Reviews.Author: dudewheresmycar
Reviews.Content: All in all, I'd say that these reviews are all pretty much on point, depending upon your perspective. Ultimately, you get what you pay for, meaning if you're expecting the Ritz Carlton -- or hell, even Motel 6 -- you'll bound to be sorely disappointed. For what it's worth, though, it was clean when I stayed there, and I didn't spy any roaches -- and didn't return with any bedbugs. Oh, and that thing that the guy wrote about the strong curry smell eminating from the check-in area -- that was completely valid. Also, there's a plethora of urban grit for those that appreciate such a thing. Plenty of, um, characters, for lack of a better term (read: homeless people that screamed at themselves late at night while I was trying to sleep) populate the surrounding neighborhood. The neighborhood itself is primarily Armenian and Thai. That in mind, there's no shortage of ethnic cuisine within walking distance. On the plus side, the hotel is only a $15 ride from LAX if you book a red van shuttle. Also, it's located just a stone's throw away from the heart of Hollywood (Hollywood and Highland), which you can reach via subway for $1 each way (a subway station is located five or six blocks away from the hotel). For those that prefer to travel by taxi: I paid $20 to go from the hotel to Barney's Beanary on Santa Monica Boulevard (blocks away from the Rainbow and Roxy on Sunset Blvd). Hope this helps. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay, even though had prepaid”
Reviews.Author: MIKNLIN
Reviews.Content: We arrived about ten in the evening on July 19th. The neighborhood is to put it mildly "scary". We were asked to give a $10. deposit for the tv remote; therefore, everytime we went out we took the remote with us to avoid "losing" it. We asked for Kleenex and were given an extra roll of toilet paper. There are no towel bars, lamps, or clock radios; in fact, nothing that the "clientele" can "mistakenly" take with them when they flee in the middle of the night. It was difficult to find another hotel in L.A. in the middle of the tourist season; but even though we had a nonrefundable prepay; we called and called until we found somewhere else and checked out. It was well worth paying twice to escape. On the positive side, the place is very clean and what is in the rooms is not shabby or worn; so if you can live with the other conditions, then it's probably a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A small motel rather than a hotel category”
Reviews.Author: h2r1v7
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Inn Express North has less than 20 rooms. It's pretty much motel6 style with a small front desk office opened 24/7. I could smell Indian curry at the front desk office as soon as I came in. There's only 1 receptionist at the reception who has actually lived and worked there. He spoke to me while eating Indian food. He might have camera to monitor the motel in and out since I was told exactly who was with me in my room. It made me feel uncomfortable. Followings are pros and cons from this motel. Pros: clean room, free outdoor parking, small refrigerator in the room making it different than motels, good and cheap Thai food rigth across the street, the homeless people around seemed to be peaceful and the area didn't seem to be unsafe. Cons: everything was rundown, the hair dryer didn't work properly, the refrigerator and the AC made noise, the curtain could not be closed properly when the AC was on, the refrigerator took a whole night to cool a beer, no internet service in the room while free internet service was mentioned in the ad. The front desk smelled Indian food. The free breakfast at the front desk was served only from 7:30AM to 8:30AM and the receptionist rushed in as soon as possible to wrap everything up for himself. The room price was high for this kind of motel in this area - 2 nites for $200 with tax included. Learning from this bad experience I would rather live in Motel6 next time for half price. I do not recommend this motel to anyone as I believe you will find better deals elsewhere with this price.

Reviews.Title: “See a different side of life...”
Reviews.Author: SLOJen
Reviews.Content: We paid about $87 (with tax) to stay here for the last night in August. Had we paid $50 or $60-something I would rate this motel as a 4 or a 5, in terms of value. I was more than a little worried about what our room might be like, but really we just needed a place to crash and were only there to explore Hollywood for the night and see the "local scenery." I've stayed at plenty of nice places in my day, but actually enjoy experiencing the other side of life once in awhile. We found our room (#125) to be surprisingly clean. (I brought my own pillow and blanket just in case, but ended up not even needing them.) The sheets were very soft and the bed was comfortable. The room had a new refrigerator, which was a nice touch. Otherwise I would say the room was very comparable to your average Motel 6. We didn't use the pool, but it looked very clean, as did the outside of the motel. It appears that it was freshly painted and we noticed that the grounds were free of trash or debris. Of course this being Hollywood there were a few questionable looking characters walking around, but certainly that's to be expected. We walked back to our room at 2am after barhopping and never felt unsafe. However, I would not roam this area alone, especially if you are female. The only cockroach we saw was on the sidewalk, further down on Hollywood Blvd. and NOT at the motel itself(!) Last but not least, make sure to go across the street to Jumbo's Clown Room. This is a great little dive bar and we met a couple of fun people here, including the bartender from Germany who recommended the ~great~ Thai food place across the street (Vim). We had a wonderful meal there - soup, appetizer, 2 entrees and 4 beers for $35. The Hollywood Inn Express is located in "Thai Town" so you will probably find great Thai food anywhere in the area. Enjoy your travels...be kind and have fun...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jesca78
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have I went to a hotel and the bathroom has had mold and baby roaches on the floor, this is the worse hotel ever and at the price that there asking it is even more awful, My friends and I quickly found another hotel and checked out, when we confronted the front desk about the mold he said there was a leak but he didn't even offer us our money back, just a word of advice don't be fooled by the pictures that are shown.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Inn Express North
HotelInfo.Address: 5131 Hollywood Boulevard, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
